cscd211Game.Players

Class Dealer

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscd211Game.Players.Dealer

  • public class Dealer
extends java.lang.Object
    The Dealer represents the person that can touch the cards and interact with the Players. The dealer contains a private array of players and the private deck that contains the cards being dealt

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int cardsToDeal
      Representing the data member for the total cards to deal
      private Deck deck
      Representing the data member for the Deck of cards
      private Player[] players
      Representing the data member for the array of Player objects

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Dealer(Player[] players, Deck deck, int cardsToDeal)
      The EVC sets the deck passed in to the deck held by the dealer It creates an array of players and copies over the players from the array that is passed in.

      NOTE: You should make a deep copy of the deck but for this assignment a shallow copy will work and you must make a deep copy of the Players array -- You can't use Arrays or clone for Players

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean cardsRemaining()
      The cardsRemaining method determines based on the number of players and the number of cards remaining if another hand can be played.
      void deal()
      The deal method deals the number of cards stored in this cardsToDeal to each player.
      void determineWinner()
      This method sums the players card values and determines a winner.
      void displayHand()
      The displayHand method displays the information about each players hand including the name of the player and the cards the player has as well as the total value of those cards.
      void reset()
      The reset method resets the players hands and resets the deck

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • players

        private Player[] players
        Representing the data member for the array of Player objects

      • deck

        private Deck deck
        Representing the data member for the Deck of cards

      • cardsToDeal

        private int cardsToDeal
        Representing the data member for the total cards to deal

    • Constructor Detail

      • Dealer

        public Dealer(Player[] players,
              Deck deck,
              int cardsToDeal)
        The EVC sets the deck passed in to the deck held by the dealer It creates an array of players and copies over the players from the array that is passed in.

        NOTE: You should make a deep copy of the deck but for this assignment a shallow copy will work and you must make a deep copy of the Players array -- You can't use Arrays or clone for Players
        Parameters:
        players - Representing the array of players
        deck - Representing the deck to play with
        cardsToDeal - Representing the number of cards to be dealt to each player
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either players or the deck are null or cardsToDeal is less than 1

    • Method Detail

      • deal

        public void deal()
        The deal method deals the number of cards stored in this cardsToDeal to each player. Each player is dealt a single card each time

      • displayHand

        public void displayHand()
        The displayHand method displays the information about each players hand including the name of the player and the cards the player has as well as the total value of those cards.

      • cardsRemaining

        public boolean cardsRemaining()
        The cardsRemaining method determines based on the number of players and the number of cards remaining if another hand can be played. For example total cards are 6. If there are 2 players each with 2 cards then the method would return false because only 2 cards are remaining in the deck.
        Returns:
        boolean - Representing if there are enough remaining cards that each player can be dealt the number of cards this cardsToDeal

      • reset

        public void reset()
        The reset method resets the players hands and resets the deck

      • determineWinner

        public void determineWinner()
        This method sums the players card values and determines a winner. If there are two players with the same sum, then a tie happened and there is no winner. If there was no tie then the Winner's name and score are displayed.
